Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the amount of money given to the Wuhan Lab in China by stating it as $3.7 million, while the actual amount was just under $600,000.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that grants to the Wuhan Lab were prohibited in 2014, as the policy that hit pause on certain research in 2014 didn't apply to the sort of work being done in Wuhan.
Understate: There is no evidence of any understatement bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: There is no evidence of any faltering bias in the provided claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it presents an incorrect amount and contradicts the actual policies and funding related to the Wuhan Lab.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the grants given to the Wuhan Lab in 2017 were prohibited in 2014, which is a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There is no evidence of any alternative explanation bias in the provided claim.
